Creates a new {{tt|std::copyable_function}}.

@1,2@ Default constructor and the constructor taking {{c|nullptr}} construct an empty {{tt|std::copyable_function}}.

@3@ Copy constructor constructs a {{tt|std::copyable_function}} whose target is a copy of the target of {{c|other}}. Otherwise, constructs an empty {{tt|std::copyable_function}} if {{c|other}} is empty.

@4@ Move constructor constructs a {{tt|std::copyable_function}} whose target is that of {{c|other}}. {{c|other}} is in a valid but unspecified state after move construction.

@5@ Let {{tt|VT}} be {{c|std::decay_t&lt;F&gt;}}. If {{c|f}} is a null function pointer, a null pointer to member value, or an empty {{tt|std::copyable_function}} (may be any other specialization), then constructs an empty {{tt|std::copyable_function}}. Otherwise, constructs a {{tt|std::copyable_function}} whose target is of type {{tt|VT}} and direct-non-list-initialized with {{c|std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f)}}.
* {{cpp/enable_if|{{tt|VT}} is neither same as {{tt|copyable_function}} nor a specialization of {{lc|std::in_place_type_t}}, and {{c|/*is-callable-from*/&lt;VT&gt;}} (see below) is {{c|true}}}}.
* The program is ill-formed if {{c|std::is_constructible_v&lt;VT, F&gt;}} or {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;VT&gt;}} is not {{c|true}}.

@6@ Let {{tt|VT}} be {{c|std::decay_t&lt;T&gt;}}. Constructs a {{tt|std::copyable_function}} whose target is of type {{tt|VT}} and direct-non-list-initialized with {{c|std::forward&lt;CArgs&gt;(args)...}}.
* {{cpp/enable_if|both {{c|std::is_constructible_v&lt;VT, CArgs...&gt;}} and {{c|/*is-callable-from*/&lt;VT&gt;}} (see below) are {{c|true}}}}.
* The program is ill-formed if {{tt|VT}} is not the same type as {{tt|T}} or {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;VT&gt;}} is not {{c|true}}.

@7@ Let {{tt|VT}} be {{c|std::decay_t&lt;T&gt;}}. Constructs a {{tt|std::copyable_function}} whose target is of type {{tt|VT}} and direct-non-list-initialized with {{c|il, std::forward&lt;CArgs&gt;(args)...}}.
* {{cpp/enable_if|both {{c|std::is_constructible_v&lt;VT, std::initializer_list&lt;U&gt;&amp;, CArgs...&gt;}} and {{c|/*is-callable-from*/&lt;VT&gt;}} (see below) are {{c|true}}}}.
* The program is ill-formed if {{tt|VT}} is not the same type as {{tt|T}} or {{c|std::is_copy_constructible_v&lt;VT&gt;}} is not {{c|true}}.

For constructors {{v|5-7}}, the behavior is undefined unless {{tt|VT}} satisfies both {{named req|Destructible}} and {{named req|CopyConstructible}} requirements.

{{cpp/utility/functional/is_callable_from_table|copyable_function}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|other|another {{tt|std::copyable_function}} to copy or move from}}
{{par|f|a function or a {{named req|Callable}} object to wrap}}
{{par|args|arguments to construct the target object}}
{{par|il|{{lc|std::initializer_list}} to construct the target object}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
@3@ May throw {{lc|std::bad_alloc}} on allocation failure or propagate the exception thrown by the initialization of the target. 
@5-7@ May throw {{lc|std::bad_alloc}} on allocation failure or propagate the exception thrown by the initialization of the target. No exception is thrown if {{tt|VT}} is a function pointer type or a specialization of {{lc|std::reference_wrapper}}.
